intro: Catha linearis, commonly known as the African coffee plant, is a flowering shrub native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae and is characterized by its linear, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into elongated, woody fruits containing seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has been traditionally used in various cultural and ritualistic contexts.
